The CHRIST-LIFE (Christ in you) is reflected by experiencing the LORD (1) as my Shepherd, (2) lack of want, (3) inner rest, (4) leading me to walk in obedience, (5) don't fear evil, (6) have God's presence, (7) peace in health / trusts, (8) meeting my needs, (9) the Spirit giving me knowledge, (10) abundant life, (11) mercy and grace daily, and (12) looking to rewards in His presence one day.
God wants to help His people 'know' Him as Shepherd so they have (1) no needs unmet, (2) no desires beyond His provision, and (3) no reason to ever stray from this wonderful relationship with Him.
God grants to those who walk with Him guidance, faith, protection, provision, Spirit-inspired living, and His presence.
God supplies the needs of those who have a heart for Him.
God directs those who have a heart for Him to live a righteous life.
God gives peace and courage to those who fear Him in the midst of troublesome circumstances.

results.text: The power of God refers to ability, might, or strength He dispenses and releases in His children.

God has chosen to bring spiritual birth through His Word.
One who only listens to God's Word - not following through on it - is deceiving himself or herself.

Christ-followers should be involved in these two demonstrations of their religion -  1) care of widows and orphans in their distress and 2) keep oneself from being polluted by the world; one with others, the other with self.
A demonstration of one's religion can involve outer and inner work.
There are religious acts or religious demonstrations that God accepts as pure and faultless:  1) care of widows and orphans in their distress and 2) keep oneself from being polluted by the world.
All things which Christ-followers possess are gifts richly and ceaselessly provided by God to be enjoyed.
Disciple makers at heart (called by God) are always trying to connect with disciples - wherever they find them.
When Spirit-filled and led ministry leaders get together and hear a report from a field of God's work, they all glorify God together.
Sometimes the Christ-followers near the one receiving a negative or troublesome prophecy speak more resistance (avoid the prophecy) than the one receiving the prophecy.
Some disciples are more zealous for traditions than for their (or others') heart beliefs and obedience to the Spirit.
Zeal for God's Word is good and is stirred up by God's Spirit, but sometimes the zeal can focus on externals.
Identifying personally and ideologically with one's audience (accusers included) is valuable.
A follower of Christ might be known as a prophet because (1) he prophesies and (2) his prophecies by the Holy Spirit have come to pass.
God 'sends' some as mobile or itinerate ministers and others as stationary ministers in fulfilling His assignments or purposes.
The spiritual gift of prophecy has been given to men and women in the body of Christ.
Spirit-filled and led Christ-followers should not let others dissuade them from obeying the LORD's leading.
Multi-cultural ministry in a location can create some awkward and sometimes confusing situations.
Ability to speak multiple languages (for a traveling servant of God) is an asset.
Because the family table (meals) is shared by disciples, family members also connect - wives, sons, daughters, etc.
Be careful not to publicly accuse a servant of God without FIRST thoroughly understanding him and having the Spirit's leading.
False rumors about your ministry may arise among your brethren - though they are many miles separated (not firsthand).
Spiritual leaders can set the record straight (correct false rumors) about their beliefs by practicing outwardly what they believe; validating outwardly their inward beliefs.

It is sad and unChristlike when religious people (novice believers or unbelievers) get very upset when their FORM of religious expression is threatened or violated - more than they get upset that myriads have not come to know peace with God through Jesus Christ; even attacking the supposed perpetrator on the basis of rumors only.
Sometimes God uses police and civil order to rescue or deliver His faithful servants who find themselves in trouble.
Knowing the history (including theological training) can be real asset in a region where such is respected.
Some families in Christ are greatly graced by God to have multiple one's in public service to the LORD.

Some loving, well-meaning Christ-followers try tight arguments and tears to dissuade a Spirit-led Christ-follower from doing what he thoroughly believes - and is yielded to do - the Spirit is leading him to do.
Jews who believe the Gospel can still practice the laws of the Pentateuch, so much of which was completed or expressed in Christ or by Christ.

Fellow leaders - being used greatly, out front, maybe for years, known among Christ-followers and Spirit-filled - will take opportunity to meet and fellowship when they find themselves in the same area.
Some say in the 'flesh' I'm ready to die for Jesus' name - while others 'in the Spirit' ARE ready to die in Jesus' name.
Fellow Christ-followers kneeling in prayer together can be a real sign of fellowship in the Spirit.
Disciples who have given and received ministry among each other want to be together where they sense God is going to work - to encourage and support one another.
Sometimes well meaning (but wrong) disciples jump to false ideas and conclusions about Spirit-led, obedient servants of God.
Through the common call of discipleship - developing Christ-followers - God can raise up warm relationships between fellow-disciples rather quickly.
Some prophesies of danger and trouble ahead are not meant to scare us or turn us away, but to prepare  us (all concerned) - putting our trust in the LORD enabling us to go forward in obedience.
To deal with a multi-cultural conflict before it gets out of hand - informed, Spirit-led leaders should implement God's plan; lifting up Scripture and obedience to it.
Gentiles (all non-Jews) who believe the Gospel do not need to become 'law-keeping Jews' to be saved; to trust God and walk by the Spirit.
Those called to equip others and make disciples find disciples - those to equip.
Even a called and gifted leader has a submissive heart toward a group of Spirit-led elders.
Fellow disciples of Jesus pursue spending time with one another - especially with a strong, well known one such as Paul - with family members, too, as much as possible.

When the consensus is 'trouble or crisis awaits you,' many may try to discourage even a Spirit-filled servant of Christ from going forward (obeying God) in order to spare him the trouble and them the grief.
Those who make disciples find disciples.
God may give insights by His Spirit - whether directly to him or through others - as to what is coming next in our life or ministry.

Whether true or not, sometimes stories about your ministry leap from one people group to another or one church to another, serving to stir up differences between them and a bone of contention toward you.
Sometimes doing what you are told by spiritual leaders (influencers) can get you beaten severely.  Remember, the Spirit had warned him more than once.
Those whose calling and ministry it is it strengthen Christ-followers do so at every opportunity God brings.
Those who follow after Jesus must be ready and committed to experience what Jesus experienced and more.
Believers need to use tact at times.
Believer should be able to make adaptations in behavior in order to relate to other groups of believers.
When one has been used by God, that one needs to point to God as the One who did the great work and who deserves the credit.
Believers need to be sensitive to nonessential beliefs held by others.
God works through the ministry of those he calls to serve Him.
Believers need to know how to make a proper appeal to local and national leaders.
Sometimes the Holy Spirit reveals difficulties believers are going to counter before the difficulties arrive.
God can work through a local or national political or legal system to rescue one of His children.
It is God who does the work worth reporting.
Physical danger can come to one who is following God's Spirit or doing God's will.
Sometimes the Holy Spirit speaks to and gives directions to believers through other believers being led by the Spirit.
It blesses the church to hear a great testimony of God's work.
Believers, even spiritual leaders, must not to be dissuaded by loving friends from doing what they believe in their heart is God's will for them.
Believers ought to praise God (overtly) when they hear a report of God's work through one of His servants.
Under the leading of the Holy Spirit, there is a time to advance forward (even) in the face of (what has been revealed to you) severe threat of arrest by authorities.
Disciples of Jesus are to spread the Word as a sower sows seed.
A disciple maker knows that some of the seed will not produce fruit.
The point of sowing seed is obvious to a disciple of Jesus - some seed will produce 100 times itself.
The stories Jesus told made sense but were not always understood as to their spiritual implications.
As a farmer, God is very interested in the fruit that is produced through the seed (Word of God) spread to people.
Real knowledge begins at the point of fear / awe / respect toward the LORD.
Gaining real knowledge in this life begins with a respectful (awesome) view of God as the LORD.
Those choose to fear the LORD will come to know the LORD and His ways.
Knowledge, wisdom, understanding, prudence, and discretion are learned.
They awesome recognition that God is LORD is the primary element with which real knowledge begins.
The wise continue to learn.
Those who despise wisdom and instruction are fools - thoughtless.
It is wise to shun evil.
Fools despise wisdom and discipline.
As one begins to recognize God, knowledge and wisdom are not far behind.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge.
Those who want to grow in the LORD must begin with an awesome respect for God.
It is wise to fear the LORD.
The body of Christ should be unified on the Gospel - it is of Christ, on Christ, and His power released in a grace gift to all who believe.
It is the LORD Jesus by the Holy Spirit who enriches Christ-followers gathered in a local assembly in giving them knowledge and proclamation gifts.
An assembly of Christ-followers should realize how blessed they are to have represented the gifts of the Holy Spirit - dispersed as the Spirit chooses among them.
God's Word puts light on the path of a Christ-follower - revealing where to walk, what to avoid, and when to proceed.
Riches, honor, and life come by humility before God and trust in God.
Training of a young child impacts her or him for life.
Christ-followers are to 'stand fast' (firm) in the LORD to avoid spiritually drifting due to false teaching or apathy.
A Christ-follower can learn to live with an abundance or with very little because of the strength or ability furnished through the relationship they have with Christ.
Christ enables His servants or children to do whatever is necessary in carrying out God's will.
Christ adds strength and ability to those doing God's will.
Without Christ's strength, a servant is grossly limited or inhibited.
Obedient servants of God will suffer need and experience bounty.
Disciples of Jesus need to learn contentment in regard to God's provision.
Those on assignment with God can do all they need to do to carry out the assignment because they receive strength () through Jesus.
What God calls His servants to do He will provide the strength through Christ in them to do.
The strength to carry out an assignment comes with the assignment God gives.
Obedient servants of God must call on the strength of the present Jesus Christ to complete the tasks assigned them by God.

Some church networks are prompted by the Spirit to financially contribute an offering in support of an apostolic team - as an exercise of obedience and stewardship and love toward the one who brought them the Gospel.

The giving ofÂ a church network as prompted by God may be fulfilled out of a struggling financial situation - such is pleasing to God and the need created by the giving will be supplied by God, Himself.
Disciples of Jesus are to spread the Word as a sower sows seed.
A disciple maker knows that some of the seed will not produce fruit.
The point of sowing seed is obvious to a disciple of Jesus - some seed will produce 100 times itself.
The stories Jesus told made sense but were not always understood as to their spiritual implications.
As a farmer, God is very interested in the fruit that is produced through the seed (Word of God) spread to people.
Jesus refers to those who believe and become disciples as members of His family.
Those disciples who hear and do God's Word are 'family' to Jesus.
Jesus desires that His disciples trust Him, trust God in the daily matters of life.

God alters the course of nature as His sons and disciples trust in Him to do so: quiet a storm, heal the sick, not give rain, give rain, open a river or sea, collapse a wall, perpetual oil, men walk out of fiery furnace, lions refuse to eat, poisonous snakes not effect, food multiplies.
Those disciples who hear and do God's Word are 'family' to Jesus.
Jesus desires that His disciples trust Him, trust God in the daily matters of life.

God alters the course of nature as His sons and disciples trust in Him to do so: quiet a storm, heal the sick, not give rain, give rain, open a river or sea, collapse a wall, perpetual oil, men walk out of fiery furnace, lions refuse to eat, poisonous snakes not effect, food multiplies.
God's truth remains THE TRUTH to all generations - even today and tomorrow.
The LORD alone is God and those in right relationship with Him are full of thanksgiving and praise as His children.
Those who enter God's court (His presence) should be full of thanksgiving and praise toward God.
Those with a heart for God give Him service, thanksgiving, and praise.
Those IN CHRIST should gladly serve the LORD.
Those void of 'real love expressed' live an empty, meaningless life.
It is always the right season for loving others with the great, great love of God abounding in our heart.
Loving God and loving others is the basis (the foundation, the acceptable motive, the right or proper motive) for all ministry.
To express God's kind of love (having received it and filled with it) is the undergirding of all service in Christ's name.
Failure to express God's love, regardless of my service, voids all profit to me.
Disciples of Christ must exhibit or express God's kind of love in all they do.
The absence of God's kind of love from life and ministry of a disciple reduces their ministry to nothing, profitless, and a 'noise maker.'
God's kind of love is evident.

God's kind of love suffers long, is kind, doesn't envy, doesn't parade itself, isn't arrogant, doesn't behave rudely, is not self-seeking, is not irritated, doesn't think on evil, doesn't rejoice at unrighteousness, rejoices in truth, bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things, never fails.
Love is the greatest virtue.
God's kind of love expressed by His people toward others is the complete, fully mature expression of God's presence.
Loving others is the greatest expression of God's reality in one's life and of His work on this earth.
Expressing God's kind of love expresses God, Himself.
Spiritual leaders are to love one another as well as loving those they lead.
God's kind of love is so full of grace.
God's kind of love is very powerful - in that it makes a radical impact on others and that it is so different from love produced by the sin nature.
Even when highly motivated to action, it is best and right to 'inquire of God' (seek God's face) to determine God's will on the matter.
When the people of God have become disobedient, it is to the LORD Himself to whom they need to turn and repent - seeking the LORD and His face.
A leader after God's heart experiences these things; (1) trust in the LORD,
(2) seeks the LORD,
(3) prays to the LORD,
(4) remains teachable before the LORD,
(5) hopes in the LORD,
(6) waits on the LORD,
and (7) draws his strength from the LORD.
Those with a heart for God readily respond to Him when He calls.
Christ-followers are to trust in the LORD through all circumstances of life.
Christ-followers should pursue their relationship with the LORD - seek Him.
Christ-followers praise God in the deliverance and peace of heart He brings.
Christ-followers are to be open to instruction from the LORD.
Christ-followers draw strength and encouragement as they wait for the LORD.

Complete furnishing of the house / equipping Christ-followers and 'structuring up' or edifying of the body of Christ-followers (corporately) requires, apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers.
There are attitudes and actions to avoid as a Christ-follower living the Christ-life and there are attitudes and actions to embrace and practice as a Christ follower living the Christ-life.
Those in Christ are to be kind and tenderhearted toward one another.
Disciples of Jesus are to avoid saying things and acting in ways that destroy relationships with other disciples of Jesus.
Damaging relationships with other disciples grieves God's Spirit and ignores or belittles the forgiveness given us by God in Christ.
Followers of Jesus are to be kind to one another, even tenderhearted to one another.
Followers of Jesus are to forgive (keep on forgiving) one another even as God in Christ forgave each his or her sins.
God's forgiveness of a believer's sins was complete, comprehensive, and continuing through the life and vicarious death of Jesus.

results.context: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
scriptures: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
results.text: What is the church doing? (1) meeting together for prayer, worship, Word, and edify, (2) equipping to maturity (disciple making and bearing witness), (3) serving one another and shining (offerings, sharing), (4) Spirit-filled - being AS JESUS toward one another, (5) called out and sent out carrying the LIFE message to new peoples, make disciples there, etc.

Christ-followers are to put away or remove - by the indwelling Holy Spirit - fleshly speech and attitudes such as bitterness, wrath (passion or rage), anger (resentment or animosity), clamor, evil speaking (switching right for wrong or calling what God disapproves right), and malice (wickedness, desire to injure, malignity).

Christ-followers are - by the Holy Spirit - to be kind (helpful or useful) to one another, tenderhearted (compassionate or understanding), forgiving the wrongs or offenses of one another - even as God in Christ forgave each one of them.
Our prayers recognize the intimacy of our relationship with God (Father) and the awesomeness of God (hallowed be Your name).
God wants His disciples or children to focus on the relationship with Him as Father.
Salvation in Christ is about a relationship with Father.
Our Father's name is to be hallowed, respected, and revered.
The residence of God is heaven.
Prayer is to be addressed to the Father.
God's name is to be hallowed - held in highest honor.
Christ-followers are invited to approach God as Father when praying.
The LORD is up in heaven - over all things.
Children go to the father to provide their needs.
Christ-followers are a family under God the Father - brothers and sisters.
The name of God stands alone as the one and only Creator and Savior, GOD.
The name of God is precious, set apart, unique, reflects His character, deserves honor and full respect from me, and is worthy of worship.
Those who search God's Word to know Him and Truth are more likely to find what they seek than mere religious traditionalists.
Oh, the blessedness of a teacher or proclaimer coming across a people prepared by God's Spirit to hear and receive the Gospel of Jesus Christ - wow - not just receive the word, BUT MANY BELIEVE.
Those, who in response to biblical preaching or teaching search God's Word, will find God's truth and believe.
Those who have God as their King (of the Kingdom of God) live under God's Kingdom principles which are different from both the 'world' and the religious.

results.context: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
scriptures: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
results.text: What is the church doing? (1) meeting together for prayer, worship, Word, and edify, (2) equipping to maturity (disciple making and bearing witness), (3) serving one another and shining (offerings, sharing), (4) Spirit-filled - being AS JESUS toward one another, (5) called out and sent out carrying the LIFE message to new peoples, make disciples there, etc.
Christ-followers who are merciful toward others are blessed - To be envied and fortunate because they, too, will be shown mercy.
Blessed, to be envied, and fortunate are the pure in heart.
The pure in heart will experience God.
Christ-followers who are peacemakers are blessed and will be called sons of God.
Those in Christ who extend mercy to others will themselves obtain mercy.
Mercy-givers are blessed, happy, and to be envied.
Been a merciful person is being like God who is merciful.
Acts of Mercy so impact the broken, hungry, ill, pour, rejected as well as others, too.
God wants the Gospel of the kingdom declared in cities and villages.
The stories Jesus told made sense but were not always understood as to their spiritual implications.
As a farmer, God is very interested in the fruit that is produced through the seed (Word of God) spread to people.
Those who know the LORD through experiencing His forgiving and healing grace and power take opportunities to give to Him out of their material possessions.

Those on mission with God and are spreading His Gospel may find those who receive God's grace SO GRATEFUL and SO LOVE-STRUCK they provide (out of their pockets) for the needs of the Gospel messengers.
God calls certain people to serve Him in certain ways and He tells the church to 'separate' them to that service.
God desires His children worship Him.
God speaks to those who worship Him and seek Him in prayer and fasting.
God's Spirit speaks - gets His message across - to God's children when He wants to give further direction to their lives.
God calls His followers to join Him in His work.

The CHRIST-LIFE (Christ in you) is reflected by experiencing the LORD (1) as my Shepherd, (2) lack of want, (3) inner rest, (4) leading me to walk in obedience, (5) don't fear evil, (6) have God's presence, (7) peace in health / trusts, (8) meeting my needs, (9) the Spirit giving me knowledge, (10) abundant life, (11) mercy and grace daily, and (12) looking to rewards in His presence one day.
God wants to help His people 'know' Him as Shepherd so they have (1) no needs unmet, (2) no desires beyond His provision, and (3) no reason to ever stray from this wonderful relationship with Him.
God grants to those who walk with Him guidance, faith, protection, provision, Spirit-inspired living, and His presence.
God supplies the needs of those who have a heart for Him.
The body of Christ should be unified on the Gospel - it is of Christ, on Christ, and His power released in a grace gift to all who believe.
God's power-packed Gospel does not need nor require cleverness of speech or 'super' understanding by brilliant people.
Those who are not saved see the message of the cross as foolishness - nonsense.
The education and wisdom of the world does not lead a person to faith in Jesus Christ.
When God's salvation message is proclaimed and people believe, they are saved.
When God's Word is learned and applied, the simple become wise and the weak become strong.
Because God's Word endures forever and the salvation that came to us through that Word, we should walk in obedience toward God and love toward others - genuinely, not in pretense.
In Christ, we have been born again of incorruptible seed through God's Word to an incorruptible inheritance reserved in heaven for us.
Even those who live lives of Spirit-led obedience need to be reminded to love one another fervently.
Fervent love with a pure (clean, sincere) heart evidences they have been born again through God's incorruptible Word, which lives and abides forever.
Flowers fade away, but God's Word endures forever.
God's Word puts light on the path of a Christ-follower - revealing where to walk, what to avoid, and when to proceed.
Christ-followers may make their plans, but trust only the LORD to 'direct his / her steps' to do the LORD's will.
Gaining God's wisdom and understanding are more valuable than gold or silver.
Those in Christ who commit their work (energy, efforts) to the LORD will find God leading and guiding their thoughts along the way.
When disciples commit their God-given work (actions) to the LORD in faith, the intentions and purposes will stand - be erected.
Disciples must receive their orders as from the LORD.
Walking in obedience fosters faith that the God-led endeavors will stand.
From Jesus' earliest words to His last, He spoke of the kingdom of God.
God allowed the persecution to come to promote His previously given injunction to make disciples of all nations, beginning at Jerusalem....

Some delays in God fulfilling His (already delivered) Word are nothing less than invitations for Christ-followers to come together in unity for prayer - seeking the LORD and the fulfilling of His Word.
This prayer meeting of men and women who loved and served Jesus went on for forty-nine days - seeking the LORD and His promise.
Jesus Christ will come again - only next time He comes it will be in the clouds as a Victor and not as a baby in a manger.
The Holy Spirit empowers or enables each Christ-follower to do God's specific will - without which (Holy Spirit) Christ-followers CANNOT do God's specific will.
Christ-followers don't need to know all the details related to the Day of the LORD - they just need to be filled with the Holy Spirit and make disciples.
Obeying God requires the essential ingredient of the presence and work of the Holy Spirit IN EACH CHRIST-FOLLOWER.
Jesus confirmed His resurrection to His apostles and many others in may ways and beyond any doubt.
Those who know Jesus through personal encounter are commissioned to be witnesses of Him to those they encounter along life's way.
The key to knowing and doing God's will in His power is directly related to paying attention to what the LORD says.
God dispenses or releases to his children some of His power, might and strength in order for them to carry out His will, purposes, and intent.

scriptures: 2 Timothy 1:7; Matthew 6:13; 11:20-23; 22:29; Mark 9:1; 12:24; Luke 9:1; 10:19; Acts 3:12; 6:8; Romans 15:13; 1 Corinthians 2:4-5; 4:20; 12:28; 2 Corinthians 4:7; 6:7; 12:9; 13:14; Ephesians 3:7, 16, 20; Colossians 1:11, 29; 2 Timothy 3:5; Hebrews 11:11; 1 Peter 1:5; 2 Peter 1:3
results.text: The power of God refers to ability, might, or strength He dispenses and releases in His children.
There are some things disciples of Christ will not know.
The Holy Spirit empowers disciples of Christ to do what He commissions them to do.
Prayer comes before moving out in obedience to God.
What Jesus Christ did on earth during His earthly ministry was just the beginning of something very great.
Jesus instructed the apostles through the Holy Spirit.
All spiritual leaders must be instructed by the Holy Spirit.
The Holy Spirit is the Divine Teacher.
The apostles were chosen to be such by the LORD.
The LORD decides who He will send in His name to proclaim His message.
Jesus Christ is alive after suffering a death.
Jesus showed Himself to the apostles - giving many convincing proofs He was alive.
Jesus appeared to His disciples over a period of 40 days and spoke about the kingdom of God.
Jesus, on one occasion, while eating a meal with the apostles, spoke to them of a gift to come.
It is important to do what the LORD leads - whether it is to do or go, or not do or not go.
What God promises, He will do.
Christ-followers are baptized - immersed with the Holy Spirit.
When Christ-followers meet together, they often inquire of the LORD.
Some things Christ-followers ask of the LORD are going to be answered by, 'It is not for you to know.'
Christ-followers are dependent upon God's Spirit to empower them to do God's will - fulfill God's purpose(s).
There are some things Christ-followers will not know in advance - other things they will.
One of the ministries of the Holy Spirit is to produce power and ability for the people of God to do the will of God.
Christ-followers have a commission to witness near and far of Christ Jesus.
Some Christ-followers have gotten to see things others haven't.
Jesus ascended through the skies in His resurrection body - visible until the clouds hid Him.
The same Jesus who lived, died, resurrected, and ascended into heaven will come back.
Jesus is coming again.
Jesus will come back the same way He went into heaven - bodily, visibly, and out of a cloud.
Disciple's are to be obedient to their teacher.
When the LORD is about to do something (great), He prompts Christ-followers to pray.
When Christ-followers are aware the LORD is about to do something (great), they get together constantly to pray.
Christ-followers need to be spending time together and need to be praying together.
Scriptures have to be fulfilled.
The Holy Spirit spoke through men to bring the Scriptures into being.
A group of Jesus' followers may not know the end of each member of the group.
The Book of Psalms has prophetic value and accuracy.
Spiritual leaders need to speak the Word of God - Holy Scripture.
Before choosing a spiritual leader, there should be heart-honest prayer.
The LORD knows everyone's heart.
Christ-followers should be honest when they pray.
Christ-followers are to look to God to choose spiritual leaders - it's God's choice that counts.
Current spiritual leaders must look to God in faith when adding other spiritual leaders.
Disciples are dependent upon the Holy Spirit for the power or ability necessary to dispense the gospel.
Holy Spirit power enables disciples to witness for Jesus.

This witnessing is to take place where people are very close to discovering God, where God's work is focused, where people are generally viewed as unlovable or despicable, and wherever people are on the earth.
The closer one\'s \"doing\" is to his \"teaching\" of God\'s Word the greater will be the impact he will have in this life.
Christ-followers living in unity is good and pleasant to be experienced.

A Spirit-filled group of Christ-followers might be characterized as (1) continually gathering for teaching from Scripture, (2) fellowshipping with one another, (3) eating meals with one another, (4) praying with one another, (5) generous with belongings, (6) care for those in need, (7) sacrificial and willing gifts to benefit the work of God, (8) meeting in public and in homes, (9) filled with praise for God, and (10) experience God adding to their numbers.
These three thousand are made up of people from sixteen different language groups as God super-charged the launching of the church, the body of Christ.
Those who believe God's message of salvation in Jesus the Christ will repent of their sins and receive the Holy Spirit.
Those to whom God grants an open heart or open ears to the Gospel often ask, 'What should I do?'
Jesus carries on a ministry today from His exalted position at the right hand of God - the pouring out of His Spirit.
Christ-followers who are Spirit-filled will also be attested by God to those they encounter along life's way.
The last days are characterized by the (1) pouring out of God's Spirit, (2) men and women proclaiming God's Word, and (3) God sending visions and dreams to people.
God get's the attention of the people through a phenomenon He produced - sound of mighty wind - and then spoke His message through the Spirit-filled disciples in many languages.
This filling by the Holy Spirit was under the control of the Holy Spirit - as the Spirit gave them utterance.
Holy boldness - courage to obey God in the face of threat and death - is a work of God's Holy Spirit.
Whoever calls out in faith on the name of the LORD shall be saved.

When God determines to invade a people, He (1) prepares messengers, (2) the time, (3) the place, (4) the people, and (4) releases on them the Gospel message, (5) drawing of the Holy Spirit, (6) His power in signs and wonders and (7) the opening of people's hearts to be saved.
THIS is THE DAY in which God has poured out His Spirit.
The Holy spirit is very active today in the affairs of man - bringing God's salvation.
The Holy Spirit is working God's works among men as well as in and through disciples of Jesus.

results.text: What is the church doing? (1) meeting together for prayer, worship, Word, and edify, (2) equipping to maturity (disciple making and bearing witness), (3) serving one another and shining (offerings, sharing), (4) Spirit-filled - being AS JESUS toward one another, (5) called out and sent out carrying the LIFE message to new peoples, make disciples there, etc.
God can enable His children to be heard speaking in a known or recognizable language not previously learned by the speaker.
The origin of spiritual things (God-honoring) is heaven.
All Christ-followers can be filled with the Holy Spirit.
When God works one of His wonders, even the unsaved world is amazed.
When God works one of His wonders, some unsaved will misunderstand, brush it off, and maybe even assign it some evil connotation.
Unsaved people need someone filled with the Spirit to explain to them the activity of God.
Spiritual leaders always emphasize fulfilling of Scripture when preaching.
This is the day (period of time) of the pouring out of the Spirit.
Each one who calls on the name of the LORD will be saved.
When God works through someone, those who observe such are responsible to recognize it is God.
God has set purposes.
It was God's set purpose for Jesus to be handed over to the Jewish leaders and Romans to die on a cross.
God raised Jesus from the dead.
It is impossible for death to hold Jesus.
Resurrection beyond the grave was taught in the Psalms through David.
The resurrection of Jesus Christ was a fulfillment of prophecy.
Jesus was raised bodily from the grave.
There were eyewitnesses to the fact for truth of the bodily resurrection of Christ Jesus.
Jesus has been a exalted to the right hand of God.
The promised Holy Spirit has been poured out on believers since Pentacost.
One can see and hear the Holy Spirit poured out on a group of believers.
The effect of being filled with the Spirit of God is visible and verbal.
Almighty God is making the enemies of Jesus a footstool for His feet.
God has made Jesus of Nazareth both Lord and Christ (Messiah).
God was in charge at the crucifixion of Jesus.
One good response to the clear preaching of the gospel is "cut to the heart"..."what should we do?"
Those who express repentance and faith toward God receive forgiveness of their sins and the gift of the Holy Spirit.
This promise is for all whom the LORD our God will call.
The unsaved need warned and pleaded with regarding their eternal state.
Sometimes there is a tremendously huge reception to preaching the truth.
Those who hear the saving message must accept it personally.
Gods way of identifying those who accept or believe the saving message is by means of water baptism.

New believers can devote themselves (1) to godly teachings, (2) to one another or the church, (3) to being together, and (4) to prayer, (5 )to reverential awe or trust - fear of God -, and (6) share their material things with one another when needs our present.
Such a spiritual environment is conducive to God working mightily through His servants.
New believers want to meet together often-whether in public worship or in private, in homes.
Those who have experienced God's salvation and forgiveness know joy and gladness.
They also know praise.
That is, they praise God for their new life in Christ.
The LORD adds to the church-the body of Christ.
God has poured out His Spirit on many who know Him so they can be proclaimers of the Gospel, declaring God\'s Word - apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, teachers.
The LORD does not operate secretly, but in the open.
Obey God by faith in the open, in real life where men can observe what it is to live a life filled with Christ - in this, God Â will be glorified.
Those who have God as their King (of the Kingdom of God) live under God's Kingdom principles which are different from both the 'world' and the religious.

results.context: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
scriptures: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
results.text: What is the church doing? (1) meeting together for prayer, worship, Word, and edify, (2) equipping to maturity (disciple making and bearing witness), (3) serving one another and shining (offerings, sharing), (4) Spirit-filled - being AS JESUS toward one another, (5) called out and sent out carrying the LIFE message to new peoples, make disciples there, etc.
Christ-followers are the light of the world.
Christ-followers are to shine before others that others may see the Christ-followers' good deeds and thereby praise God in heaven.
As Christ-followers live their lives by God's design and purpose, others will praise God.
Disciples of Jesus are to do the good works openly which God has ordained for each to do.
The good works of Christ's disciples are a "light" of testimony to the glory of God.
God has always been concerned about the heart condition (leaning, devotion) of those who name His name.
A man with God's understanding / knowledge is of a calm spirit, holding his peace.
Wisdom, knowledge, and understanding are found IN THE LORD and in knowing the LORD.

God's kind of love suffers long, is kind, doesn't envy, doesn't parade itself, isn't arrogant, doesn't behave rudely, is not self-seeking, is not irritated, doesn't think on evil, doesn't rejoice at unrighteousness, rejoices in truth, bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things, never fails.
Spiritual leaders are to love one another as well as loving those they lead.
God's kind of love is so full of grace.
God's kind of love is very powerful - in that it makes a radical impact on others and that it is so different from love produced by the sin nature.
Those who attain great wealth, wisdom, and recognition would do well to recognize God as the Source.
The Source of financial and material acquisitions by Christ-followers is indeed God alone.
God gives people the ability and strength to produce wealth.
Those who are God's people (Christ-followers) actually depend on God and do what He says.
God humbles His people to test (assay) them.
God is the Source of our wealth as Christ-followers.
Blessed Christ-followers are to beware lest they lose focus on God while focusing more on their assets.
Stewardship includes one's ownership of property - land, house, car, jewelry, etc. - which came to them by God's grace.
Christ-followers TODAY may be outcast by traditional churches because (in the traditional churches) they  don't have a personal knowledge or relationship with the Father or the Son of God.
The LORD has brought to reality the 'guidance' of His Holy Spirit to each Christ-follower.
For Christ-followers, the Holy Spirit is our Helper and Guide - guiding us to know God's truth and guiding us to know the things yet future.
Disciple makers try to help their disciples avoid stumbling.
Those who obey the Father have the presence of the Father with them always.
Knowing how good the joy is going to be enables one to endure the sorrow and difficulties today.
The Holy Spirit will guide Christ-followers into truth, give revelations, and tell future things to come.
As the LORD's revelation of Himself and His instructions cannot be delivered at one time, but must be spread out over time, SO ALSO disciple makers must teach with patience their disciples over time.
Truth and revelation from the LORD must come to Christ-followers over time - not all at once.
Disciples of Jesus are urged by Him to put their requests to the Father in the name of the Son with assurance.
The Spirit of God will declare to disciples of Jesus the things of God.

scriptures: 1 Peter 1:11; Romans 8:9; John 14:26; John 15:26; John 16:13; Romans 8:14; 1 Corinthians 3:16; 1 Corinthians 2:12
results.text: He is the Spirit of Christ, Helper, Teacher, Truth, Guide, of God, Comforter, Revealer of what has been given Christ-followers by God and what is to come.
The Holy Spirit is an advantage to Christ-followers.
God knew that redeemed man needed the Holy Spirit living in him to live victoriously.
Hearing from God's Spirit is critical to knowing and doing God's will.
The Holy Spirit glorifies Jesus Christ by revealing to disciples Jesus and what Jesus is doing.
The Holy Spirit is God's HELPER to every Christ-follower and disciple.
The Holy Spirit is God's provision to each one who is redeemed.
God's Spirit is the Spirit of Truth - sent to guide into truth the disciples of Jesus Christ.
God gives to the leaders of His people what He wants them to know.
The Spirit of God stirs or prompts those He is going to work through.
The Holy Spirit knows the future.
The Holy Spirit glorifies Jesus Christ by making known to believers what the LORD Jesus said and did.
The Holy Spirit is the Spirit of truth.
A Spirit-filled person will glorify Jesus as Lord!
The Spirit guides believers into all truth.
The Holy Spirit will also make known to the believer the things from or of the LORD.
Christ wants His followers to know and experience a genuine love relationship with His (and their) Father.
Some genuine expressions of faith in the LORD are at depths of experience which by God's grace will increase to greater or deeper faith in the LORD.

There is a great joy to be experienced and owned by disciples of Jesus who come to know (1) He lives eternally at God's right hand and (2) all the promises (Word and words) of Jesus and Father are true.

Because Jesus is at God's right hand and because the Holy Spirit reveals truth, guides, and speaks (tells) heavenly messages to disciples of Jesus, disciples of Jesus may ask the Father "whatever" IN ALL JESUS IS and the Father will indeed grant those requests SO THAT the joy and delight in the heart of the disciples comes to full measure (fills up, completed).
It is so important to understand Jesus returned to the Father's side from which He came into this world - to the glory He had before at God's right hand.

When times of persecution and suffering come to faithful followers fo Christ, they need to remember what Jesus said (chapters 14, 15, 16) in order to avoid stumbling or falling away: (1) obey Jesus' teachings, (2) experience intimacy with the Father, (3) your much fruit will remain, and (4) the Holy Spirit (Helper, Comforter) is with you.
Those IN CHRIST can have peace and courage in a troubled and conflicted world because Jesus has overcome (prevailed, conquered, deprived the world of power to harm) the world.

Disciple makers make decisions, take actions, and express teachings that are beneficial or advantageious (from a maturity and God-perspective) to their disciples - whether or not the disciples undersand it fully in the moment.

The Holy Spirit will work through the witness of faithful Christ-followers to convince the unsaved of sin (missed the mark), of righteousness (Jesus lived a righteous life), and of divine judgment (satan is sentenced already).
Sometimes a disciple maker speaks to his disciples in figuratevely about a spiritual truth; other times speaks spiritual truths plainly (freedom of speech).
Jesus' sending the Holy Spirit (Helper, Comforter, Advocate) to each disciple of Christ brought to them - as to each today - an advantage (profited them) over having Jesus physically near them.

The advantage of the Holy Spirit to the faithful follower of Christ is that He will (1) convince (prove) the unsaved they have sinned against God and missed the mark, (2) convince the unsaved (prove) what is right (righteousness) from God's viewpoint, and (3) convince the unsaved (prove) of God's judgment and its sentence.

For those IN CHRIST, the Holy Spirit (Spirit of Truth) WILL AS A MATTER OF FACT (1) guide them into all truth, (2) speak to Christ-followers what God tells Him, (3) tell them things to come, and (4) glorify Jesus by taking from all that is of Christ and revealing (declaring, reporting) it to them - the latter repeated twice back to back for emphasis.

Those who are in an intimate daily walk with the LORD doing what He says out of a love relationship (1) are to express a servant heart toward others in the body of Christ, (2) express love to others in the body of Christ, (3) experience ever-more open communication with the LORD, (4) are taught and guided by the Holy Spirit, (5) will experience peace in a troublesome and antagonistic world, (6) will bear much fruit, (7) experience ever-increasing joy, (8) and IN CHRIST experience overcoming (to prevail, to conquer, victorious) the world.
Disciples of Christ can ask OF THE FATHER through Jesus (at God's right hand) as Jesus asked the Father throughout His life - an open and intimate communion between Father and sons.
Once a follower of Jesus experiences Jesus alive (revelation of Jesus) and a confirmation of His promised Word (words revealed or fulfilled) the "heart joy" they experience cannot be taken from them.
To be walking with God in obedience by faith - experiencing His presence daily - is an awesome and available reality for those IN CHRIST.
Sometimes those who persecute faithful followers of Christ think they are doing a service to God.
A disciple maker needs to know God's timing related to what he is teching his disciples.
The revelations, declarations, leadership, and guidance of the Holy Spirit are essential (not optional) to each Christ-follower to knowing and doing God's will.
Jesus (at God's right hand) and the Holy Spirit (sent to each disciple) provide each disciple the perfect ASK opportunity.
As the cloud (and pillar of fire) above the tabernacle led Israel in the wilderness, so today the Holy Spirit leads (leads and more) Christ-followers.
So much of the life-in-Christ is fulfilled by the ministries of the Holy Spirit.
The Holy Spirit teaches Christ-followers the Truth and the application of Scripture in order that our salvation and eternal life will be experienced by faith.
The teachings by Jesus ideal with both the inner man (thoughts, motives) and his actions.
The LORD does not operate secretly, but in the open.
God often directs His people to show mercy and grace to foreigners - even to those who create problems - as in Jesus' teaching to love your enemies....
The law (all the requirements of the Law) has been fulfilled by and in Jesus Christ.
If Christ-followers don't love the unlovable, they are no different than those without Christ.
This is one hunger God will gladly fill - the hunger and desire to walk in obedience by faith toward God.
Live according to your word; yes is yes and no is no - be consistent and integrous.
The righteousness required to enter heaven is accomplished only by Jesus Christ and acquired by imputation in us by faith in Jesus and His finished work.
Men commit sin within their mind or heart (short of the act) by desiring the sinful act.
Those who keep their heart pure (clean) will see and experience God in ways the impure will not know.

Christ-followers are to be SALT to this world - (1) it takes a lot of salt to preserve a society, (2) it takes some salt in or on food items to stir thirst for water in people, and (3) Â it takes only a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor of food - making it more attractive to the pallet.
The possession of a prideful and unforgiving heart PRECLUDES real worship of God - thus, confession and reconciliation need first to be addressed before worship.
Christ-followers are to love their enemies, even ministering (do good and praying for them) to them in God's love and power.
Reconciliation of broken relationships is a higher priority than (a prerequisite to) offering public worship to God.
Obey God by faith in the open, in real life where men can observe what it is to live a life filled with Christ - in this, God Â will be glorified.
Those who humble themselves and come to the LORD in trust will know heaven as their home.
Take some abuse and even go an extra mile toward abusers, God will strengthen you and avenge the wrong doing.
Those who do what God says and teach others to do what God says will be acknowledge for such (by God's grace) in heaven.
God's intention for a man and woman in marriage is a life-time relationship marked by love, commitment, sacrifice, and involvement.
Those who are very strong (able, capable), yet keep it under control, will be successful entrepreneurs and leaders on earth.
Those in Christ who are persecuted for their obedience to God by faith will have heaven as their home.
Those who have God as their King (of the Kingdom of God) live under God's Kingdom principles which are different from both the 'world' and the religious.
Those who are reviled and persecuted for Christ's sake may rejoice - even be exceeding glad - because their reward in heaven will be great!
Those who are persecuted for righteousness sake will inherit the kingdom of heaven.
Christ-followers who are reviled and persecuted for Christ's sake will receive great rewards in heaven.

scriptures: Acts 11-17; Ephesians 4; Acts 2, 4, 11; Matthew 5; Ephesians 5; Colossians 3
results.text: What is the church doing? (1) meeting together for prayer, worship, Word, and edify, (2) equipping to maturity (disciple making and bearing witness), (3) serving one another and shining (offerings, sharing), (4) Spirit-filled - being AS JESUS toward one another, (5) called out and sent out carrying the LIFE message to new peoples, make disciples there, etc.
God blesses the humble and broken - poor in spirit.

If one obeys God's Word and teaches others to do so also, that one will be called great in heaven.

A mind or attitude to lust for a woman is sinful in the eyes of God.
The Word of God will stand through time.
Those who do God's Word and teach others to do it will be called great in God's kingdom.
If Christ-followers treat only Christ-followers well (in love) what reward is there for this?

Christ-followers may even extend grace to persons who demand something or request something by giving MORE than requested or demanded.
Love, blessings, grace, acts of service, and intercession are to be given to our enemies, persecutors, and abusers.
The word of a Christ-follower with YES or NO is to be all that is needed - an oath is no more.

A disciple is to yield his or her entire body and mind to the Lordship of Jesus Christ.
God is gracious to the saved and the unsaved.
As God gives sunshine and rain to the saved and the unsaved, so Christ's disciples are to give love and grace to the saved and unsaved.

The best worship is with a clean heart.
Willfully allowing a wrong to persist without pursuing forgiveness precludes honest worship of God.
Disciples are God's righteous salt to an otherwise corrupt (rotten) society.
Followers of Jesus must 'get right' before they 'worship right.'
Unjustified anger toward others is sinful - inhibiting one's worship and honor of God.
Christ-followers who are merciful toward others are blessed - To be envied and fortunate because they, too, will be shown mercy.
Those Christ-followers who are meek are blessed, happy, and fortunate and are going to inherit the earth.
Jesus Christ came to fulfill the Scriptures.
Blessed and fortunate are those who mourn for they will be comforted.

God's Word will come to pass as it is written.
It is possible to commit sins in one's thoughts.
Christ-followers who hunger and thirst for righteousness - living right before God - will be filled or satisfied.
Christ-followers must rejoice even under persecution because great will be their reward in heaven.
Christ-followers are to pursue working out such ill feelings with others - seeking reconciliation.
It is a serious matter to hold anger toward another or to harbor contempt for another.
Christ-followers (salt) are (1) to bring out the best around them, (2) preserve what is right and good, and (3) purify or clean up what is corrupt around them.
Christ-followers are the light of the world.
Those who disobey and teach others to disobey God's Word will be called least in the kingdom.
Christ-followers live and operate in a different world, under a different set of principles.
Spiritual hunger and thirst will be met by the LORD.
Inheritors in God's kingdom will be happy and blessed when they express and experience true humility.
The pure in heart will experience God.
Those, on the other hand, who practice and teach others to practice God's Word will be called great in the kingdom.
The humble are blessed.
Blessed, happy, fortunate are those who have spiritual hunger and thirst for righteousness.
Christ-followers who are peacemakers are blessed and will be called sons of God.
False things may be said against those who live a righteous life.
Blessed, to be envied, and fortunate are the pure in heart.
Those persecuted for righteousness will be part of the kingdom of heaven.
Christ-followers are the salt of the earth.
Reconciliation with others is to precede offering prayers, praise, and worship toward God.
Blessed, to be envied, and fortunate are Christ-followers who are persecuted because of their righteousness.
Christ-followers are to shine before others that others may see the Christ-followers' good deeds and thereby praise God in heaven.
There are sins one can commit in one's mind.
If a Christ-follower looses his saltiness, he is good for nothing in regard to God's purpose.
Christ-followers are to give - allow to borrow - to those who ask to borrow.
Jesus would have Christ-followers protect and guard their hearts against such sins.
Christ-followers give more than what is asked for, more than what is expected.
God gives grace to Christ-followers and unbelievers.
Christ-followers are to be in the process of maturing - developing into one like their Father.
Christ-followers are to love their enemies as well as their neighbors.
Christ-followers are to be people of integrity.
Casual discarding of marital partners is a serious offense (sin) in the eyes of the LORD.
Christ-followers are to pray for those who persecute them.

Christ-followers are responsible to approach another Christ-follower who has something against them and try to work it out.

Christ-followers are to seek reconciliation.

Those who break God's commands and teach others the same will suffer loss in God's kingdom.
Disciples of Jesus are to honor, keep, and obey God's Word.
Those in Christ who extend mercy to others will themselves obtain mercy.
Been a merciful person is being like God who is merciful.
Disciples of Jesus will draw to themselves "reviling and persecution" from religious leaders simply because they are diligently following Jesus.
God's Word is the plumbline for living and for ministry.
Blessed, happy, to be in seat are those who seek righteousness - right living from God's viewpoint.
Worldly and fleshly appetites distract one from seeing God.
Heart belief and commitment in God's Word is essential to obtain entrance into God's kingdom.
How does salt lose its saltiness? (1) too little of it, (2) gets watered down, or (3) never gets used or applied (isolated from life).
The good works of Christ's disciples are a "light" of testimony to the glory of God.
Those in Christ who hunger and thirst for righteousness will be filled with righteousness by God.
Disciples of Jesus are to be like salt to people (1) make life taste better, (2) make others thirsty for Jesus, and (3) preserve life and culture from spoiling.
Give to those who ask to borrow.
Peacemaking or reconciliation is what Christ-followers and bring to a situation.
Some Christ-followers will be persecuted for doing what God says is right, living right from God's perspective, or simply obeying God.
A life not salty is worthless.
Furthermore, such sinful attitudes and actions (unconfessed) prevent one's worship of God.
Treating these this way expresses our Father's nature which is at work in us - Christ-followers.
Blessed, happy, to be envied are those Christ-followers who bring God's peace to others.
One who does God's commands is in a good position to teach God's commands.

Christ-followers are to seek reconciliation with the offended ones before worship of God.
Mercy-givers are blessed, happy, and to be envied.
Jesus would have His followers do something extra, beneficial, or blessed unexpected" to those who coerce or compel certain actions.
Disciples of Jesus are to do the good works openly which God has ordained for each to do.
Christ-followers are not to swear oaths or vows to do or not to do something but simply do the will of God.

Acts of Mercy so impact the broken, hungry, ill, pour, rejected as well as others, too.
Those who are persecuted for obeying God have the kingdom of heaven as theirs.
Adultery of heart or mind, self-gratification, and physical adultery are sinful, wrong in God's eyes.
God intends that Christ-followers remain married the original partner and that they both be sexually true to one another.
Christ-followers are to keep their bodies and minds sexually pure.
Followers of Jesus are not to retaliate for wrongs done to them.
Christ-followers are to be like (express) the Father.

Those who mourn (out of death, pain, sorrow, tragedy, sickness) learn of the LORD leaning on Him as they do and thus are blessed and to be envied.
Christ-followers want and need to seek God at work.
God blesses those Christ-followers who are very strong and able yet who are controlled under the Holy Spirit in meekness.

Blessed, happy, to be envied are those whose heart is singularly on the LORD.

Those who are meek (very strong, but under the Holy Spirit, not putting forth their power) will inherit the earth (rewards here).
Those Christ-followers who desperately want to live is Christ (right in God's eyes) God will certainly see to it.
God's Word does not become archaic to those in relationship to God.
Disciples of Jesus emphasized doing what God commands.
Unrighteous anger, condemnation, and ugly criticism of others are put by Jesus in the category with murder and therefore condemned.
Those in Christ who are generous with their God-given resources by supplying food to the poor are blessed - happy, to be envied.

A Christ-follower can be generous toward those who request to borrow from them.
Blessed are the peacemakers as a struggle or fight is ended.
Those in Christ who reach out for, receive, apply, seek, and search for God's wisdom will know it.
God's children who earnestly seek from Him wisdom and understanding will receive such.
Following God's wisdom keeps one from the evil, evil people, and evil ways.
Walking uprightly with the LORD is intricately connected to wisdom and understanding from the LORD.
From a humble heart, one would do well to remain in God's Word daily - applying it to life daily.
Happiness, gain, and honor come to those who have God's wisdom and understanding.
The wisdom and understanding that come from God through applying God's Word are most valuable.
Wisdom and understanding our tree of life to those who apply the same.
Life with honor, peace, and riches is characteristic of the believer who lives God's wisdom.
As a matter of fact, nothing is more valuable than applying God's wisdom.
Meaningful life is a benefit of living God's wisdom.
Those who embrace God's wisdom will be blessed - are fortunate.
Knowing and applying God's wisdom is of more value than silver or gold.
